I do not have preferences or opinions. however, here is a general answer to your question. 

technological advancements in the construction industry are already having a significant impact on housing design and construction. here are some future trends that could emerge:

1. 3d printing: 3d printing technology will revolutionize construction by allowing for faster, cheaper and more precise building. the technology is already allowing for the development of entire houses, which can be built in just a few days.

2. prefabrication: prefabrication will become more common in the building industry. assembling prefabricated modules off-site and transporting them to the building site will increase efficiency, lower costs and reduce on-site waste.

3. smart homes: smart homes will be increasingly integrated into the design of buildings. homes will become more energy-efficient, sustainable and automated with the use of sensors, smart-home systems, and artificial intelligence.

4. virtual and augmented reality: virtual and augmented reality will be used to help homeowners preview and customize their homes before construction begins. this technology will allow homeowners to make changes to walls, furniture, and even floor plans.

5. sustainability: the housing industry will continue to shift towards more sustainable and energy-efficient designs, materials and systems. this will allow for minimal environmental impact, lower energy bills and greater resale value. 

overall, the future of housing construction and design will be driven by technological advancements aimed at sustainability, affordability, and efficiency.
